intro: Petasites formosanus, commonly known as the Formosan buttercup, is a flowering plant native to Taiwan. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes sedges and other herbaceous plants. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and clusters of small, yellowish flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as mountain forests and stream banks. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
